This guide will help you set up shared folders in VMWare Workstation Pro for UNIX guest VMs such as Kali Linux or Ubuntu.
There are 2 main steps to set up shared folders:
In VMWare settings, create a shared folder In the host machine, edit “Settings” of the VM -> go to “Options” tab -> go to “Shared Folders” row -> Add a new shared folder In the guest VM, create a folder. This folder will contain the shared folder from the host machine In your guest VM, set up a shared folder Temporary shared folder Use vmhgfs-fuse command sudo vmhgfs-fuse .host:/ <shared_folder_name> -o allow_other -o uid=1000 OR Use mount command sudo mount -t fuse.vmhgfs-fuse .host:/ /mnt/hgfs -o allow_other Permanent shared folder vim /etc/fstab Add this line: .host:/ /mnt/hgfs fuse.vmhgfs-fuse allow_other 0 0 Reload entry sudo systemctl daemon-reload sudo systemctl restart local-fs.target

I passed the OSCP and OSCP+ in late 2024 so to give back to the community, I made a tool to set up Kali VM with the essential tools needed for OSCP.
During my preparation for the exam, I spent a lot of time figuring out which tools and versions to use which was frustrating and wasted valuable lab time. For example, I had issues with the latest version of SharpHound and BloodHound. So I had to downgrade and use the earlier versions to resolve incompatibility issues.
Also, there were so many potatoes to use for Windows SeImpersonate privilege. But I relied on only 3 potatoes for the win: GodPotato, PrintSpoofer and JuicyPotato-ng.
The versions and tools in xpimpmykali have been tried and tested on Kali Linux VMware 2024-4. I used these exact tools for my exam as well.
To run this tool, follow the steps below:
Take a snapshot of the VM in case the installation doesn’t go well git clone https://github.com/xkat3rZ/xpimpmykali.git cd xpimpmykali sudo ./pimpmykali.sh Enter option menu ‘S’, enter ‘Y’ to confirm Wait for about 5-10 mins for the installation to complete Check that the tools are installed in the /opt directory
